data.title: Any museum that has a resident cat must be great
data.text: A lot of photographs of the area and interesting settlement history.  If you live in Ark, Okl, or Mo area, or have relatives in this area, it's a must see.

data.title: So beautiful and educational!
data.text: The work that they have done on this beautiful site is breathtaking. It is so much fun to stroll the grounds and learn about history at the same time. My daughter and I had a great time and we will be back!

owner_response.author: Susan Y, outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words, Jennifer. We are proud of our museum campus and work hard to make it an inviting place for people of all ages to enjoy during all seasons of the year. Glad you and your daughter had fun--come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great place
data.text: This is a building that was originally a general store and post office.  There is also a smaller building that was a school.  It was a great stop.  Very enjoyable!

owner_response.author: Susan Y, outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. Glad you enjoyed the historic buildings on our museum campus! Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Learn about the history of Springdale!
data.text: A lot of information on the history of northern Washington County and Springdale.   Books, collections, historical items and interpretive exhibits giveva reflection of the Springdale area.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach Coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. Come back and see us soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great adventure in local history
data.text: Great interior exhibits and grounds buildings.  Very friendly staff.  Love to view local area historic artifacts.

data.title: Quaint and Simple
data.text: Nothing fancy here, but worth a quick visit to learn about the area. Enjoyed learning about Springdale history with chickens and orchards.  Our two young boys enjoyed the farm exhibits outside.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We're glad you and your family enjoyed your visit. Come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A must see place in Springdale!
data.text: Very interesting museum exhibits pertinent to the region. Wonderful staff, particularly Marty who does the grounds work. Definitely put this one your list of things to do in Springdale!

data.title: Great museum to discover the history of the area.
data.text: I love history and enjoy visiting museums. This museum sets itself apart by telling the history of the area.  Certain days and times of the year people are dressed up in period apparel. It's both educating and fun.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words. Our education staff love to don their living history garb! True history geeks, they are. 

Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Shiloh Museum Review
data.text: This is an excellent history museum. The museum has no fee but does ask for donations.  There is also a small but very unique gift shop on the property to help raise money.  There are great depictions of the history of Arkansas and of the local area with historical items of the past to the present.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. Come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ozark History Fun
data.text: Liked the local history tidbits available and the amount of history here on the NWA. As a transplant, I was unaware of some of the fun things in Springdale as well as the NWA region bad in their own history.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Welcome home, transplant! Thanks for coming by to check out what is now your history. Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great history of Springdale
data.text: great slice of the history of Springdale. Very good special events like the quilt fair and other events that highlight the area with special exposure for the rural parts of NWA

data.title: Amazing Piece of History
data.text: This is a great stop with a very knowledgeable staff to answer your questions about Civil War and Ozarks History.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words, Robin. We love our home-grown visitors! Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to take kids to learn about early life in the Springdale area.
data.text: This is a small but interesting museum.  Kids enjoy it, and adults can learn more about the early days of life in the Springdale area.

data.title: Perfect for a family outing/local history
data.text: The grounds of the museum are a true gem. Step back in time and experience an original Ozarks cabin, barn and school house on the museum's quiet and serene lawn just off the Razorback Regional Greenway. Inside the museum, the exhibits give you a taste of the history of Northwest Arkansas. Cut off from much of the outside world by mountainous terrain in the 1800's, the people of the Ozarks developed a unique culture that is wonderfully celebrated and illustrated by Shiloh Museum. They generally have a couple of exhibits inside to educate patrons and often host special events or lectures on the weekend. I visit regularly as it's a perfect stop along the bike trail. The staff is kind and a whole lot of fun. Definitely great for a family visit or just a quiet way to spend an hour on the weekend.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach Coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words. We're especially delighted to hear that you're accessing the museum from the Razorback Regional Greenway. 

Come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great little museum
data.text: This is a great place to spend an afternoon. They have various exhibits that cover prehistoric time to the present. There is a lot of cool local and Arkansas history.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. We appreciate our good friends in Madison County! Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: wonderful place to visit anytime of the years
data.text: I like to make frequent visits thorough out the year as there are always something new to see. this is not limited to just Springdale history alone. The displays of items and pictures really tell a history of the area that can't be achieved anywhere else. A great place to bring children of all ages to understand and learn of their forbearers. Also they have workshops and interesting people giving talks as well as videos. I recall my first visit. I couldn't believe that such a small place could offer so much.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. We love our local folks!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Springdale's Shiloh  Museum
data.text: Springdale used to be called Shiloh, then changed its name to Springdale. It's Shiloh Museum highlights the area's native people, pioneers, folk music, Sam Walton,  hogs, and chickens. Springdale is the 4th largest city in Arkansas. Tyson remains the city's largest employer. AR governor Beebe recognized Springdale as Poultry Capital of the world in 2013. The museum exhibits were attractive and easy to understand. We did not have time to see the historical buildings on the grounds behind the main building. Staff was knowledgeable and helpful.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. Come back and see us next time you're up this way from Texas!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Local History
data.text: Lots of local history, beautiful grounds, in the heart of Springdale. New Razorback Greenway biking trails run along side so you can take a detour. It's free to walk around and see at how the area has grown.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words. We especially appreciate our hometown visitors. 

Come back and see us when you can.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Interesting Look At Arkansas Past
data.text:
I stopoed in at the Shiloh Museum on a visit to northwest Fayetteville. It popped up on Google Now as a place to see. 
The museum is run well has a wealth of artifacts and exhibits to take you deep into Arkansas history and culture. Full replicas of covered wagons, cabin life, hillbilly life, moonshine industry, right up to Tysons industries chicken takeover of the world. What was missing was any mention of the dreaded Walmart Empire that is also based in Arkansas. 
The ground of Shiloh museum also have several original building dating way back to give you a real walk in hands on feel for the life back then.
A small well organized well run museum with a friendly knowledgeable attentive staff.
It was a fun visit.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your kind words. We're in the midst of a several-year remodeling process of our exhibit hall. A brief history of Walmart will be included in that revamp.  

Come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cool Arkansas History
data.text: This is a cool place to go though when you are killing time. These was no charge but they do take donations.

owner_response.author: Susan Y, Outreach coordinator at Shiloh Museum of Ozark History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for your kind words. Come back and see us when you can!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
